<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px; padding-bottom: 5px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
BUSINESS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/29/the-top-5-business-stories-from-the-third-quarter?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The Top 5 Business Stories From the Third Quarter
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/29/the-top-5-business-stories-from-the-third-quarter?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Sirisha Bandla sits on Richard Branson’s shoulders with fellow astronauts Beth Moses and Colin Bennett" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/a2c18583ecf1fad747b6935060103e5cf37e6509-1024x683.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Patrick T. Fallon/AFP vs. Getty Images<br></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Our goal for this section: Take the entirety of business news that happened over the last three months and distill it into the 5 stories that <em>truly </em>mattered. Here’s what we came up with.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">5. Spaceflight takes off</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It’s hard to say just yet, but this summer could be considered a Wright brothers moment for commercial space travel. Billionaires Jeff Bezos and Richard Branson blasted off to space in homegrown rockets. And while he didn’t go to space himself, Elon Musk did something even more impressive—SpaceX sent the first all-civilian crew into orbit on the Inspiration4.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Something the industry still needs to figure out: literally astronomical costs. Tickets for Virgin Galactic space flights start at $450,000 a seat.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">4. China’s crackdown</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">China’s government tightened the screws on numerous industries as it tries to center the country’s culture around an ideal of “common prosperity.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In no particular order, Beijing has a) expanded its ban on crypto-related transactions b) limited the amount of time kids can play video games c) stopped ride-hailing giant Didi from signing up new customers d) banned “effeminate” men from appearing on TV e) blocked tutoring companies from taking profits, and much more.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The new regulations amount to one of China’s most dramatic attempts to reset the relationship between business and culture in recent memory.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">3. Extreme weather</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">From record-shattering temps in Oregon to Hurricane Ida in the East, weather disasters affected nearly 1 in 3 Americans this summer. These weather events, plus a new UN report that deemed climate change a “code red for humanity,” sparked more conversation around climate mitigation and adaptation efforts.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Will it lead to action? Democrats cited failures of our current system (like the NYC subway flooding) as justification for the bipartisan $1.2 trillion infrastructure bill they’re hoping to pass this week.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">2. Delta</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Hot Vax Summer fizzled out as the highly contagious Delta variant sent Covid cases soaring once again. The wave also created more urgency from the government and businesses to get employees vaccinated. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">While some large corporations mandated vaccinations early on, the Biden administration turned the volume up to 11 when it said that all companies with 100 or more employees need to ensure their workers are vaccinated, or otherwise present a weekly negative Covid test. Good news is, the Delta wave appears to have peaked in many pockets of the US.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">1. Supply chain madness</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Turns out, the Ever Given being stuck in the Suez Canal was the least of our supply chain worries this year. Factory closures in Asia due to Covid-19 have prolonged bottlenecks, driving inflation higher and delaying your new couch from arriving.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Some stats that illustrate the brokenness of the global supply chain:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The chip shortage will cost $210 billion this year, according to a new estimate.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Nike said 80% of its shoe factories in Vietnam are closed.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>This month, the line of container ships waiting to enter Los Angeles’s and Long Beach’s neighboring ports hit an all-time high of 65 vessels.</span></li>
</ul>
</div>

<td style="padding: 15px; padding-bottom: 5px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GRAB BAG
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/29/the-7-craziest-facts-we-learned-in-the-third-quarter?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Facts on Facts
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/29/the-7-craziest-facts-we-learned-in-the-third-quarter?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Starbucks drinks " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/ec4025ccdd0f28fe549126fa10978ba08aae27e4-1024x768.jpg?rect=0,98,1024,599&w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Starbucks </em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We read a <em>lot </em>of news stories over the past three months. Here are some of the craziest facts we learned.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">1. At Starbucks, Pumpkin Cream Cold Brew <a href="https://finance.yahoo.com/news/starbucks-pumpkin-spice-latte-returns-to-the-menu-others-like-dunkin-panera-release-fall-lineup-130028798.html?utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">outsold</a> the Pumpkin Spice Latte last year.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">2. Uber has saved many lives that would’ve been lost to drunk driving, according to a <a href="https://www.nber.org/papers/w29071?utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">new study</a> based on internal Uber data. Ride-sharing has decreased alcohol-related US traffic fatalities by 6.1% and reduced overall US traffic deaths by 4%.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">3. 45% of remote employees work from a couch regularly, according to a <a href="https://craftjack.com/toolbox/remote-work-from-home-statistics-2021/?utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">study</a> from home improvement marketing firm CraftJack. It gets even crazier: 38% of remote workers work from their bed regularly, 20% work outdoors, and 19%...in a closet.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">4. There will be <a href="https://www.axios.com/wedding-industry-backed-up-busy-pandemic-86d89a77-bfcd-465a-b70c-f747d4eea728.html?utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">more weddings</a> in the US in 2022 than in any year since 1984, according to market research firm The Wedding Report. It estimates that 2.5 million weddings will take place next year, compared to an average of 2.1 million weddings/year pre-pandemic and 1.2 million weddings in 2020.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">5. Average pay at US supermarkets and restaurants hit <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/2021/08/08/fifteen-dollar-wage/?utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$15/hour</a> for the first time ever, according to the Washington Post. Nearly 80% of US workers now earn a minimum of $15/hour, compared to 60% in 2014.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">6. More than 45% of young people surveyed across 10 countries said climate change <a href="https://www.bbc.com/news/world-58549373?utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">caused them anxiety</a> and affected their daily lives. 56% said they thought humanity was doomed.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">7. Women accounted for a <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/college-university-fall-higher-education-men-women-enrollment-admissions-back-to-school-11630948233?mod=hp_lead_pos10" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">record 59.5%</a> of college students at the end of the 2020–2021 school year, while men made up just 40.5%.</p>
</div>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">

</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">

<img alt='Yoda saying "Impossible to see the future is"' style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/348aed869411a206be35a65982a15f38023b1bf1-480x208.gif?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In the last quarterly email, we asked readers to predict five outcomes by September. So, how’d you do?</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">1. Will Jeff Bezos successfully return from his mission to space?</strong></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">92% correctly answered yes. The other 8% of you will definitely not be astronauts.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">2. Which crypto asset will perform the best: dogecoin, bitcoin, or ethereum?</strong></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">57% of readers predicted ethereum, which was correct. Ethereum gained nearly 50% last quarter.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">3. Will the Olympics go off without disruption due to Covid-19?</strong></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Most of you were pessimistic about the Olympics: 61% incorrectly predicted Covid would disrupt the Games. The Olympics actually handled Covid really well.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">4. Will another US company join Microsoft and Apple in the $2 trillion market cap club? The two right now are Amazon and Alphabet.</strong></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Neither Amazon nor Alphabet reached a $2 trillion market cap, contrary to the predictions of Brew readers. 66% guessed at least one of those companies would.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">5. Will Aaron Rodgers still be a Green Bay Packer?</strong></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">55% said no, but Rodgers is playing for the Packers this season and he is in fact still quite good.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">That was fun, let’s do it again. <a href="https://twitter.com/MorningBrew/status/1443592323267321866?s=20" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Click here</a> to cast your vote for next quarter’s predictions.<br></p>
</div>

style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003ePatrick T. Fallon/AFP vs. Getty Images\u003cbr\u003e\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOur goal for this section: Take the entirety of business news that happened over the last three months and distill it into the 5 stories that \u003cem\u003etruly \u003c/em\u003emattered. Here’s what we came up with.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003e5. Spaceflight takes off\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIt’s hard to say just yet, but this summer could be considered a Wright brothers moment for commercial space travel. Billionaires Jeff Bezos and Richard Branson blasted off to space in homegrown rockets. And while he didn’t go to space himself, Elon Musk did something even more impressive—SpaceX sent the first all-civilian crew into orbit on the Inspiration4.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSomething the industry still needs to figure out: literally astronomical costs. Tickets for Virgin Galactic space flights start at $450,000 a seat.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003e4. China’s crackdown\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eChina’s government tightened the screws on numerous industries as it tries to center the country’s culture around an ideal of “common prosperity.”\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn no particular order, Beijing has a) expanded its ban on crypto-related transactions b) limited the amount of time kids can play video games c) stopped ride-hailing giant Didi from signing up new customers d) banned “effeminate” men from appearing on TV e) blocked tutoring companies from taking profits, and much more.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe new regulations amount to one of China’s most dramatic attempts to reset the relationship between business and culture in recent memory.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003e3. Extreme weather\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFrom record-shattering temps in Oregon to Hurricane Ida in the East, weather disasters affected nearly 1 in 3 Americans this summer. These weather events, plus a new UN report that deemed climate change a “code red for humanity,” sparked more conversation around climate mitigation and adaptation efforts.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWill it lead to action? Democrats cited failures of our current system (like the NYC subway flooding) as justification for the bipartisan $1.2 trillion infrastructure bill they’re hoping to pass this week.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003e2. Delta\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eHot Vax Summer fizzled out as the highly contagious Delta variant sent Covid cases soaring once again. The wave also created more urgency from the government and businesses to get employees vaccinated. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhile some large corporations mandated vaccinations early on, the Biden administration turned the volume up to 11 when it said that all companies with 100 or more employees need to ensure their workers are vaccinated, or otherwise present a weekly negative Covid test. Good news is, the Delta wave appears to have peaked in many pockets of the US.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003e1. Supply chain madness\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTurns out, the Ever Given being stuck in the Suez Canal was the least of our supply chain worries this year. Factory closures in Asia due to Covid-19 have prolonged bottlenecks, driving inflation higher and delaying your new couch from arriving.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSome stats that illustrate the brokenness of the global supply chain:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe chip shortage will cost $210 billion this year, according to a new estimate.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eNike said 80% of its shoe factories in Vietnam are closed.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThis month, the line of container ships waiting to enter Los Angeles’s and Long Beach’s neighboring ports hit an all-time high of 65 vessels.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-top: 12px;\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.facebook.com/sharer.php?u=https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/09/29/the-top-5-business-stories-from-the-third-quarter\u0026utm_source=facebook_share\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"text-decoration: none;\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"\" style=\"display: inline-block; At Starbucks, Pumpkin Cream Cold Brew \u003ca href=\"https://finance.yahoo.com/news/starbucks-pumpkin-spice-latte-returns-to-the-menu-others-like-dunkin-panera-release-fall-lineup-130028798.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eoutsold\u003c/a\u003e the Pumpkin Spice Latte last year.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e2. Uber has saved many lives that would’ve been lost to drunk driving, according to a \u003ca href=\"https://www.nber.org/papers/w29071?utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003enew study\u003c/a\u003e based on internal Uber data. Ride-sharing has decreased alcohol-related US traffic fatalities by 6.1% and reduced overall US traffic deaths by 4%.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e3. 45% of remote employees work from a couch regularly, according to a \u003ca href=\"https://craftjack.com/toolbox/remote-work-from-home-statistics-2021/?utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003estudy\u003c/a\u003e from home improvement marketing firm CraftJack. It gets even crazier: 38% of remote workers work from their bed regularly, 20% work outdoors, and 19%...in a closet.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e4. There will be \u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/wedding-industry-backed-up-busy-pandemic-86d89a77-bfcd-465a-b70c-f747d4eea728.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emore weddings\u003c/a\u003e in the US in 2022 than in any year since 1984, according to market research firm The Wedding Report. It estimates that 2.5 million weddings will take place next year, compared to an average of 2.1 million weddings/year pre-pandemic and 1.2 million weddings in 2020.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e5. Average pay at US supermarkets and restaurants hit \u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/2021/08/08/fifteen-dollar-wage/?utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e$15/hour\u003c/a\u003e for the first time ever, according to the Washington Post. Nearly 80% of US workers now earn a minimum of $15/hour, compared to 60% in 2014.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e6. More than 45% of young people surveyed across 10 countries said climate change \u003ca href=\"https://www.bbc.com/news/world-58549373?utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecaused them anxiety\u003c/a\u003e and affected their daily lives. 56% said they thought humanity was doomed.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e7.
